intro: Hemitelia escuquensis, commonly known as the Escuque hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
